name: Xyporia
description:
Xyporia is a sandbox game about Cyan, an alien-like being that drops from the fourth dimension into the third dimension. Unfortunately, they can't navigate around the world, so they rely on mimicking the movement of objects around them.

You can select as many objects as you like, combining the unique movement patterns to launch, push, and swing Cyan in all directions.

With that, get out there and explore the world!

Warning: The game may cause motion sickness for some people; especially when Cyan is connected to several objects at the same time and moves very quickly. So, please stop playing if you don't feel well.

Credits:

Game Designer and Character Modeler: Logan Mulder

Programmer: Chandler Shi

Level Designer: Valerie Chen

Narrative Designer: Daniel Thomas

Composer and Sound Designer: Ali Saneei


The assets used are free assets downloaded from https://kenney.nl/.


Special Thanks to:

JT Hampson for proposing the tethering effect. 

And everyone who made this game better by giving us valuable feedback. 

Made during the Design Week of Winter 2023, Honours Bachelor of Game Design, Sheridan College.
